mdRecord.dcterms:title: Saint Margaret's Convent Chapel, interior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Street, George Edmund (English architect, 1824-1881) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Sisters of St Margaret were founded in 1855 by Dr John Mason Neale at Rotherfield, England. As their numbers increased, they moved into their first convent, Saint Margaret's in East Grinstead, Sussex. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Society_of_Saint_Margaret [work]
Construction on the convent began in 1865, and the chapel was finished in 1883. Additions were made at various points in time. [work]
